TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StatusBar extends System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl
.class public auto ansi StatusBar extends System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl

Docs.summary: Represents a control that displays items and information in a horizontal bar in an application window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel). For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> is a bar that typically displays a horizontal row of images and status information. You can divide the items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> into groups that contain related items, by using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> controls. The items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> can display text, graphics, or other complex content. Items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> are defined as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> objects.
Events that are defined on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> are raised when the user clicks the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> does not receive keyboard focus.
The following illustration shows an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>.
**Status Bar**
![Status bar](~/add/media/ss-ctl-statusbar.GIF "Status bar")
## Customizing the StatusBar Control To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property. You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance. For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md). To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>, see [StatusBar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/statusbar-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the control's default style. If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application. The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running. For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
[!INCLUDE[setting-a-visual-property](~/includes/visual-property-note.md)]
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>.
[!code-xaml[StatusBar_Snips#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StatusBar_Snips/CS/Window1.xaml#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the menu selects different item containers, depending on the type of the item in the underlying collection or some other heuristic.
Docs.value:
the menu selects different item containers; otherwise, .
The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is useful if you want to create a menu by binding to a collection. The item container is the UI element that displays the object in a collection. If you want to bind to a collection to create a menu that contains objects and objects, set the property to true and create an for each type of object in your collection. Each must contain either a or a . ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
